news_header: A Swedish court sentenced far-right activist Rasmus Paludan to four months in jail for inciting hatred against Muslims during protests in 2022.
news_text: Rasmus Paludan, a far-right activist, was sentenced to four months in jail by a Swedish court for inciting hatred against Muslims at protests in Malmo in 2022, where he burned a Quran. The court found his remarks offensive and not part of a responsible discourse. Paludan plans to appeal the verdict, which follows similar charges in Denmark. The incidents have strained Sweden's relations with Turkey, impacting its NATO membership bid.
